medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. ___ is a ___ y/o male with a history of epigastric discomfort for many years, typically resolving after ___ hours and not related to eating. Two days prior to admission, he experienced similar epigastric pain but developed pain in the right lower quadrant (RLQ), which worsened with movement and twisting. He had anorexia, two episodes of emesis two days ago, and frequent bowel movements but no diarrhea. The pain waxes and wanes, but he remains quite tender in the RLQ.
